info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A line of showers capable of producing funnel clouds will affect Hancock.....McDonough...southwestern Van Buren... southwestern Lee...Scotland and Clark Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 320 PM CDT...lA line of showers capable of producing funnel clouds were located along a line extending from Memphis, Missouri to Keokuk, Iowa to Macomb, Illinois. The storms were moving slowly south at 10 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Macomb, Keokuk, Carthage, Kahoka, Memphis, Bushnell, Hamilton, Warsaw, Colchester, Augusta, Wayland, Bowen, Industry, Milton, Good Hope, Prairie City, Bardolph, Wyaconda, Cantril and West Point. Funnel clouds of this nature are short lived and rarely touch the ground. However, if you notice one approaching the ground, move indoors to a place of safety. The National Weather Service will continue to closely monitor the situation. Please forward reports of funnel cloud sightings to the nearest law enforcement agency for relay to the National Weather Service.
